YAMG (yet another map geek)
#Cartonaut

You and I are animals that evolved in a universe with at least 3 dimensions plus time. We've been orienting and reorienting ever since we were single cell organisms in the ocean and in the womb. With our senses we've been mapping as long as we can remember (literally, memory is key to our ability to map) and it comes to us like breathing. I'm here to celebrate big deep gulps of fresh maps.

Partner emeritus
@Trueventures Started GigaOm
I was a reporter once. I blog about tech @ http://om.co My Tumblr: http://Om.blog. Subscribe to my FREE Newsletter: http://om.co/newsletters/

I am the Leslie Chair of Innovative Brain Research and Professor at UCLA in the Dept of Integrative Biology and Physiology and in Psychiatry and in Neurobiology. My lab investigates the mechanisms used by sleep to consolidate memories, gain insight, and resolve emotional distress. The National Institute of Mental Health provides grant funding and I have 6 PhD students, 1 postdoctoral scholar, a lab technician and 6 undergraduates conducting the research. I hope to use sleep mechanisms to cure PTSD, drug addiction, and other mental and neurological conditions.

Restoring and running old tech with modern mashups. TTYs + micros + printers = creative coding, conservation, art, hacking, history

Also: professor, engineer, dad, husband, traveler, hiker, bike+train commuter, listener, reader, thought kneader
